alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 10:20AM PDT until May 22 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Spring snowmelt and rain from showers and thunderstorms will produce increased high flows on the Stehekin and Kettle Rivers. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM PDT Friday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM PDT Friday was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage through Monday afternoon with the stage climbing as high as 24.7 feet tonight and again Sunday night. The Stehekin River will recede below flood stage by late Monday and continue to fall early next week with the arrival of cooler temperatures. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 06/05/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Cold and swift flowing rivers can be life threatening this time of year. The combination of cold water shock and fast current increases the danger of drowning in our rivers. Keep an eye on children if they are playing near rivers and put a life jacket on them. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM PDT.
